You can create an Minimum indicator object that is not bounded to any automatic update and choose which data it should use. To use it, please refer to the reference table below.

Minimum()1/1

            Minimum QuantConnect.Indicators.Minimum (
    *string                       name,
    Int32                        period,
    *Nullable<Resolution>  resolution,
    *Func<Decimal>         selector
   )

Creates a new Minimum indicator to compute the minimum value

Parameters
*string name (Optional) The custom name of the indicator whose min we want.
Int32 period The look back period over which to compute the min value.
*Nullable<Resolution> resolution (Optional) The resolution.
*Func<Decimal> selector (Optional) Selects a value from the BaseData to send into the indicator, if None and the name is of type TradeBar defaults to the Low property, otherwise it defaults to Value property of BaseData (x => x.Value).

Return

Minimum - A Minimum indicator that compute the in value and the periods since the min value

Definition at file Indicators/Minimum.cs.


You can use two methods to update the indicator: automatic or manual.

Automatic Update

In this method, you will recreate the basic indicator usage: create the indicator with its constructor and register the indicator for automatic updates with the RegisterIndicator() method, but could be using a custom resolution via a Consolidator.

private Minimum _min;
// In Initialize()
_min = new Minimum(period);
_min.Updated += IndicatorUpdateMethod;

var thirtyMinuteConsolidator = new TradeBarConsolidator(TimeSpan.FromMinutes(30));
SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

RegisterIndicator(symbol, _min, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

// In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if (_min.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _min.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.min = Minimum(period)
self.min.Updated += self.IndicatorUpdateMethod

thirty_minute_consolidator = TradeBarConsolidator(timedelta(minutes=30))
self.SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirty_minute_consolidator)

self.RegisterIndicator(symbol, self.min, thirty_minute_consolidator)

# In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if self.min.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.min.Current.Value

Manual Update

Updating your indicator manually allows you to control which data is used and create indicators of other non-regular price fields. The indicator objects have the Update() method that updates the state of the Minimum indicator with the given a trade bar, a quote bar, or a custom data bar.

With this method, the indicator will only be ready after the Update() method has been used to pump enough data.

private Minimum _min;
// In Initialize()
_min = new Minimum(period);

// In OnData()
if (data.ContainsKey(symbol))
{
    _min.Update(data[symbol].EndTime, data[symbol].High);
}
if (_min.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _min.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.min = Minimum(period)

# In OnData()
if data.ContainsKey(symbol):
    self.min.Update(data[symbol].EndTime, data[symbol].High)
if self.min.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.min.Current.Value
